intro: Trigonosciadium solhanense, commonly known as the Solhan mountain spinach, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
